data.title: Aircraft Carrier traits
data.body:
Could it be possible to add new traits for the aircraft carrier to let it: 
- [ ] rearm aircrafts while also still being mobile
- [ ] repair aircrafts while also still being mobile
- [ ] let it create new aircrafts after being imobilized
## <bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Improved Widget text customizability rev.2
data.body: As the title says, this improves the customizability of of various text widgets. Meant as replacement for #4080.

data.title: Scroll up at the map edge (bug)
data.body:
It seems to be possible to scroll up the map 10 or 15px from the top/edge.

This is annoying because the view scrolls even if you want to click on buttons that are at the top (Options, Cheats, Sell...)

data.title: Remove camo pillbox cloak sound
data.body: Doesn't seem to make sense being a concrete building and all

data.title: Frame limiter text box can be edited when it's disabled

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Might not just be limited to this text field.

To repro:
- Open settings
- Uncheck the frame limiter setting, if not already unchecked.
- Enter in some random characters.

data.title: Sniper cannot garrison Desert tileset church
data.body: Sniper cannot garrison Desert tileset church

data.title: Asset Browser Renovation
data.body: Fixes crashes described in #4125 and #3980 as well as adds some missing features from #2532 that I still owe to @xanax plus I need the palette switch for the Tiberian Sun mod which uses many more different palettes than the other mods and XCC Mixer completely fails for me there.

data.title: Multiple buildings increases building speed
data.body: I really like the feature in the original RA (and C&C?) where multiple war factories increase the unit build speed. Please consider adding this, if it does not imbalance the game considerably.

data.title: Fixed crash when the last production building was killed while the mouse was still hovering over the build palette
Hardened the new Rank effect against crashes
data.body:
#4134

The `anim.PlayFetchIndex` is probably the most important change. I had a temp level variable before which only got updated during ticks and when the actor is alive. @pchote suggested to remove it for cleaner code and I forgot to add something to avoid the trait lookup from dead actors.

This also adds `.IsDead()` checks everywhere. They may be redundant, but I found them together with `.IsDestroyed` in other effects that have a trait look-up in their constructor.

data.title: Fixed and improved cycle hotkeys
data.body: The first commit is mostly a fix to #4144. The second hotkey does something similiar to what @TiriliPiitPiit manually hacks into each release for himself, but more generic. I also needed another hotkey to balance the two pane layout. ;)

data.title: Add ability to load not patched/patched libs from custom paths as distributions polices dictate
data.body: Currently almost all libraries are loaded from the same OpenRA game directory.

data.title: Shift+Tab no longer cycles backward

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
In previous versions (<1112) hitting the Tab key would cycle through the build queues top to bottom and Shift+Tab would cycle backward (bottom to type).

The Tab key now works about 50% of the time and the functionality of Shift+Tab is broken completely.

OSX 10.7.5

data.title: Intentional? MGG has same gap radius as GG.
data.body:
Mobile Gap Generator has the same size gap radius as a regular Gap Generator tower. If anything I think the towers radius should be increased instead of lowering the MGG's.

Or maybe I'm just seeing things wrong?

data.title: Add option to change or disable sidebar hotkeys.
data.body: They get in the way when trying to remap controls.

data.title: Removed Proxmity trait everywhere
data.body: as discussed in #2617.

data.title: Add map scripting support
data.body:
This adds support for map scripting. I will be introducing additional functionality along with a couple of missions written in Lua and an abstract Lua OpenRA interface for shared code after this PR. We can close #2067 then. Our Missions namespace will slowly go away as I move more things over to Lua.

This uses a custom version of lua51 from monoboxedlua with sensitive functionality disabled, so we shouldn't ship unmodified versions of Lua as-is. I have also modified LuaInterface so it can work with OpenRA. That's why it's included in the sln.

The Lua error handling is pretty barebones, but it does show script syntax errors etc and halt. You can still crash the game from Lua though. We will want to move error stuff to an actual panel later when we also get better error recovery features from desyncs and such.

Lua script files currently don't count towards map hashes. We can add this and also increment the MapFormat when we add some other features like additional map rules files outside of map.yaml.

Packaging script changes need testing/review, especially the Windows installer and dependency stuff. I'm not totally happy with the changes myself.

data.title: Game crashes when attempting to render yaml smudges

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
```
Smudges:
    cr1 60,79 0:
```

```
Red Alert Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.6407
Exception of type `System.IndexOutOfRangeException`: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.SmudgeLayer.Render(WorldRenderer wr)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.TerrainRenderer.Draw(WorldRenderer wr, Viewport viewport) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\TerrainRenderer.cs:line 59
   at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.Draw() in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\WorldRenderer.cs:line 120

   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 114
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 38
```

"Tentative de lecture au-delà de la fin du flux." means "Attempt to read beyond the end of the stream." (this manual translation is a good example of #3820)

data.body: To hunt down bottlenecks in the renderer like the ones @TiriliPiitPiit reported. Maybe traits from the existing perf.log could go to cpu.log and rendering to gpu.log or something.
